title: docs: Add og:image for social sharing
docs: Polish the tutorials and docs breadcrumbs
Is there a functionality to add system admin, project admin and further annotators for different projects?
body: Something similar to Django application, where all these functionalities are present

title: feat(task): new text2text task api and client
body:
This is a WIP PR providing a task (just in API) for text2text tasks (machine translation, sumarization,...). Once this PR is discussed and approved, we can make efforts to bring the integration with client and UI.

The api record data model proposed is (common record properties are omitted):
```yaml
---
title: Text2TextAnnotation
description: |-
  Annotation class for text2text tasks
required:
- agent
- text
- score
type: object
properties:
  agent:
    title: Agent
    type: string
  text:
    title: Text
    type: string
  score:
    title: Score
    maximum: 1
    minimum: 0
    type: number
---
title: Text2TextRecord
description: The output text2text task record
required:
- text
type: object
properties:
  text:
    title: Text
    type: string
  prediction:
    "$ref": "#/components/schemas/Text2TextAnnotation"
  annotation:
    "$ref": "#/components/schemas/Text2TextAnnotation"
```

For search queries, `predicted_as` and `annotated_as` fields are removed and 2 new fields are available for text search on those fields `text_predicted` and `text_annotated` .

title: ID -> Username
body: In the Login screen of the Rubrix UI, the two fields say: `ID` and `Password`. I think `Username` and `Password` would be better. In our documentation we rather use *username* than *ID*.

title: Docs: Add advanced setup guides
body:
This PR adds a section to the docs called *Advanced setup guides*. It includes the setup with vanilla docker, running on AWS, configuring ES with other applications, and the users management. I left various references to the advanced guides where it made sense.
See the docs here: https://docs.rubrix.ml/en/feat-revise_docs/getting_started/advanced_setup_guides.html

title: refactor(search): simplify query text search model

labels.name: type: breaking changes
labels.description: This issue or PR may include breaking changes in the code

body: Simplify `query_text` input for search, accepting only string values

title: refactor: improve index task extension
body:
Instead of setting specific task index settings (properties, analyzers,...) this PR include code refactoring to allow task include its own es configuration.

See [here](https://github.com/recognai/rubrix/pull/273/files#diff-4e658dba045835ec32c8251b1f51f608b56971dfc55d40d368e559f595e76f5eR18) or [here](https://github.com/recognai/rubrix/pull/273/files#diff-318638962be6ea85b3db60587a924c7ba8decfaa97740e370fff39358fddc36dR22) for details

title: Feat/users management

labels.name: type: breaking changes
labels.description: This issue or PR may include breaking changes in the code

body:
This PR normalizes user management and basic authentication. 

- Now, rubrix server enables user basic authentication 
- An default user/pass + api key is automatically configured if no auth setup
- Default api key and pass can be override using env vars
- User management based on basic yaml file
- rubrix client uses the default api key if no api key is provided.

TODO:

- Include user management documentation
- update App references in documentation
- Validate user data model

title: feat(search): store text variant with special characters for search
body:
This PR include an input text variant in elasticsearch index that stores the special character. Then, api search combine this new field enabling queries with special characters (`!` or `?`)

Note: Old indices must be re-created for enable this feature. Non-stopped words are available, otherwise.

title: feat(app): copy datasets feature

labels.name: type: breaking changes
labels.description: This issue or PR may include breaking changes in the code

body:
This PR addresses discussions from [this issue](https://github.com/recognai/rubrix/issues/136)

Dataset copy internally uses  elasticsearch [index clone](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/7.13/indices-clone-index.html), that requires source index in read-only mode. Logging records into a dataset that is being copied could lost data. 

The clone index feature is include since version 7.4.x, so rubrix instances using older elasticsearch versions won't support this new feature

Although the `aggs` response contains updated `predicted_mentions` the sidebar does not update the numbers until you manually refresh the browser window.

This can be reproduced with the `spacy_tutorial`:

Without query (2000 records):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1107111/126619668-0beb9240-d468-4d40-b75a-d29440487298.png)

With query (1000 records):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1107111/126619756-295cadf2-8aa1-49c0-ae6c-703617ff9fd7.png)

With query (1000 records) after refresh:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1107111/126619822-9a730393-35a5-4550-9115-fc30b4d03253.png)

- [x] Text class view (Annotation progress, Stats: 1. Keywords 2. Error distrib)

Small screen : deploy blocks as a new layer under the UI
Large Screen: Block are deployed by default on the right side, user can hide them by click on the icon bt

title: [UI] Do not show "confidence" percentage in text classification annotation mode
body:
When annotating records in text classification and the record contains predictions:

- You initially see the score for each label (e.g., 80% positive, 20% negative), this is fine.

- If the user then annotates (selects a label) the selected label automatically shows 100%. This has confused some of our domain experts, and also leads to a visual inconsistency: following the above example, if I select negative which was 20% as the label then I see Negative 100% and Positive 80%.

Option A:

When the label is active (this is selected by the user) do not show the confidence/probability.

Option B:

On annotation mode don't show confidence values at all.

What do you think @leiyre @Amelie-V @dcfidalgo @frascuchon ?

}

title: Feat: similarity vector
body:
This PR adds a `record_embedding` parameter to the `TextClassificationRecord` model, to be used in cosine-similarity searches.
It also adds a check to the `rb.log` method, but I feel like we should catch the error code of the API in this case, rather than checking this explicitly before.

This PR is a work in progress, the server side, as well as the UI component is still missing.

title: Bugfixes/mentions calculation
body:
This PR store token classification mentions (predicted and annotated) as `[key,value]` pair list, in order of calculate related metrics (mentions per entity) properly.

The main change is defined by the setting as `nested` type the mentions related fields.

title: Error message when introducing predictions with unvalid format
body:
This example misled me:

```
{'Unnamed: 0': 0, 'id': 3334, 'text': '@sexyany99 Te daria $1000 x p*ta eso te mereces amor a mí me encantan las p*tas', 'label': 'discredit'}
ValidationError: 1 validation error for TextClassificationRecord
prediction
value is not a valid list (type=type_error.list)
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ValidationError                           Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-19-66b59178c1f9> in <module>
      4 
      5 for record in annotation_ds:
----> 6     records.append(rb.TextClassificationRecord(
      7         inputs=record["text"],
      8         annotation=record["label"],

~/Documents/RecognAI/rubrix/src/rubrix/client/models.py in __init__(self, *args, **kwargs)
    132     def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
    133         """Custom init to handle dynamic defaults"""
--> 134         super().__init__(*args, **kwargs)
    135         self.status = self.status or (
    136             "Default" if self.annotation is None else "Validated"

~/anaconda3/envs/rubrix/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pydantic/main.cpython-38-darwin.so in pydantic.main.BaseModel.__init__()

ValidationError: 1 validation error for TextClassificationRecord
prediction
  value is not a valid list (type=type_error.list)
```

This error might be common, we can specify that a format error is happening and how to correctly format a prediction.

title: Elasticsearch question
body:
(Looking at docker-compose)
Can I use an Elasticsearch instance I already have? for example by creating a `rubrix` user in Elasticsearch. If so;
  - Which roles & permissions would rubrix need?
  - Does rubrix create indexes with a certain name pattern like rubrix_* ? (If so I could just give all permissions for those indexes)
  - How would I pass username/password (environment variable ELASTICSEARCH_USER/ELASTICSEARCH_PASSWORD ? along with ELASTICSEARCH: address)

Or rubrix need full access to the elasticsearch instance, in which case must have its own elasticsearch.

title: [UI] Mentions sidebar
body: fix #141
